title: The history of marriage - Alex Gendler

options.text: To establish social status and wealth

options.label: D

title: Why is glass transparent? - Mark Miodownik

multiple-choice.question: **Knowledge**

options.label: A
options.text: Glass is made from multiple tiny bits of quartz.

options.label: B
options.text: Glass is made from silicon dioxide, which is commonly found in sand.

options.label: D
options.text: Glass is made from a combination of oxygen and nitrogen.

multiple-choice.question: **Comprehension**

options.label: A
options.text: Glass is a crystalline solid that forms when quartz is heated to a high temperature.

options.label: B
options.text: Glass is an amorphous solid that forms when quartz is heated to a high temperature and then cools.

options.label: C
options.text: Glass is a liquid that forms when quartz is heated to a high temperature.

options.label: D
options.text: Glass is a gas that forms when quartz is heated to a high temperature.

multiple-choice.question: **Application**

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Glass is used as a building material because it is inexpensive and easy to install.

options.label: D
options.text: Glass is used as a building material because it is non-toxic and environmentally friendly.

multiple-choice.question: **Analysis**

options.label: A
options.text: The transparency of glass is due to the fact that it has a crystalline structure.

options.label: B
options.text: The transparency of glass is due to the fact that it has an amorphous structure.

options.label: C
options.text: The transparency of glass is due to the fact that it has a mixture of crystalline and amorphous structures.

options.label: D
options.text: The transparency of glass is due to the fact that it has a uniform microscopic surface.

multiple-choice.question: **Synthesis**

options.label: A
options.text: The transparency of glass is due to the fact that it has a crystalline structure and is made from silicon dioxide.

options.label: B
options.text: The transparency of glass is due to the fact that it has an amorphous structure and is made from a combination of oxygen and nitrogen and silicon dioxide.

options.label: C
options.text: The transparency of glass is due to the fact that it has a uniform microscopic surface and is made from silicon dioxide.

options.label: D
options.text: The transparency of glass is due to the fact that it has a mixture of crystalline and amorphous structures and is made from a combination of oxygen and nitrogen.

multiple-choice.question: **Evaluation**

options.label: A
options.text: The transparency of glass is a necessary quality for it to be used as a building material.

options.label: B
options.text: The transparency of glass is a desirable quality for it to be used as a building material.

options.label: C
options.text: The transparency of glass is an essential quality for it to be used as a building material.

options.label: D
options.text: The transparency of glass is an important quality for it to be used as a building material.
